verses.roman:
tāṅra nābhi-padma haite uṭhila eka padma
sei padme ha-ila brahmāra janma-sadma

synonyms: tāṅra nābhi-padma haite—from His lotus navel; uṭhila—grew; eka—one; padma—lotus flower; sei padme—on that lotus flower; ha-ila—there was; brahmāra—of Lord Brahmā; janma-sadma—the place of generation.
translation: "A lotus flower then sprouted from the lotus navel of that Garbhodakaśāyī Viṣṇu. That lotus flower became Lord Brahmā's birthplace.
